definitions: foot: a unit of linear measure equal to 12 inches
fort: used to describe a defensive or military structure
feat: an achievement that requires great skill or courage
freight: goods transported by truck, train, ship, or aircraft
furnace: an enclosed structure in which material can be heated to very high temperatures
examples: The soldiers gathered at the ft.
His ft in the competition was unmatched.
They loaded the ft onto the plane.
The ft heated the entire building.
